lead_paragraph: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. -- Alex Rodriguez was onto something Saturday night when he said "it's probably going to take a while" for him to hit his 600th career homer. It seemed unlikely to happen on Sunday, when Rodriguez was held out of the lineup for the Yankees' series finale with the Rays. He had played the last 13 games, and Manager Joe Girardi felt Rodriguez could use a break from the Tropicana Field turf.
snippet: Joe Girardi gave Alex Rodriguez the day off. He has gone nine games and 37 at-bats since his last home run.

headline.main: Still Chasing 600, Rodriguez Is Not in Yankees Lineup

abstract: Joe Girardi gave Alex Rodriguez the day off. He has gone nine games and 37 at-bats since his last home run.
